definition: essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: Filial piety is one of the moral creams in Chinese traditional culture.
sentences.chinese: 孝，是中國傳統文化的道德精義之一。

sentences.english: In modern society the right-oriented doctrine is the soul of the system.
sentences.chinese: 在現代社會，權利本位是貫穿整個系統的精義。

sentences.english: THAT IS THE DIFFERENCE and THAT is what WWII combativesis really all about.
sentences.chinese: 差別就在這裏，這就是二戰格鬥術的所有精義所在。

sentences.english: That the Sermon on the Mount contains the sum and substance of Christianity.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌登山訓衆論福所講的一切包含了基督教的精義。

sentences.english: This seems to be, in many ways, the essence of his teaching.
sentences.chinese: 從很多層面看來，這看似他講學的精義所在。

definition: study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
to be content with poverty and strive for virtue (idiom)
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
to write on the blackboard/writing on the blackboard
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
divination combined with mystical Confucian philosopy, prevalent during the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220)
